title: relation "typeorm_metadata" does not exist while creating a view in migration
body:
## Issue Description

This issue is probably related to [4923](https://github.com/typeorm/typeorm/issues/4923), pull request [4956](https://github.com/typeorm/typeorm/pull/4956) doesn't seem to work here.

### Expected Behavior

I try to implement a migration that creates views for postgres. Before that migration another migration installs all tables successfully (fresh installation). I'm running the migrations manually using the typeorm-cli.

I'm using the following code to create a view (just for testing before implementing the real query):

````typescript
 console.log(`Create view...`);
    await queryRunner.createView(new View({
      name: 'tool_view',
      materialized: false,
      expression: (connection: DataSource) => {
        return connection.createQueryBuilder(ToolEntity, 'tool').select('*');
      }
    }));
````

It should create a view that just represents the same table as "tool".

### Actual Behavior

I get the following error message:

````
QueryFailedError: relation "typeorm_metadata" does not exist

  query: 'INSERT INTO "typeorm_metadata"("database", "schema", "table", "type", "name", "value") VALUES (DEFAULT, $1, DEFAULT, $2, $3, $4)',
  parameters: [
    'public',
    'VIEW',
    'test_view',
    'SELECT * FROM "tool" "tool"'
  ],

}
````


### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a Datasource connection for PostgreSQL
2. Create a migration and implement code that creates any view.
3. Run the migration using the typeorm -cli.

### Possible solution

Create "typeorm_metadata" automatically next to "typeorm_migrations" table. That would ensure that the typeorm_metadata table exists.
